for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. `` It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page. Both men, along

`` I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better!'' wrote Eric Schmidt in a post on Google's official blog. Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead.
Page will take over April 4, with Eric Schmidt taking the title of executive chairman, in which, Eric Schmidt said, he will focus on building relationships with customers, business partners and the government.

. Zahi Hawass wrote, in a post to his Web site, which, due to the blocked Internet access at the time, he had to fax to colleagues in Italy to upload: My heart is broken and my blood is boiling. I feel that everything I have done in the last nine years has been destroyed in one day, but all the inspectors, young archaeologists, and administrators, are calling me from sites and museums all over Egypt to tell me that they will give their life to protect our antiquities.
